dt.t: Each book in the library had been carefully {wi}accessioned{/wi}.

shortdef: to record in order of acquisition

dt: {bc}the act or process by which someone rises to a position of honor or power

dt.t: Queen Victoria's {wi}accession{/wi} to the throne/crown occurred in 1837.

dt: {bc}an act of coming near or to something {bc}{sx|approach||}, {sx|admittance||}
{bc}acquisition of additional property (as by growth or increase of existing property)
{bc}the act by which one nation becomes party to an agreement already in force between other powers

et: borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}accession{/it} "acquisition, increase" (Old French also "attack of an illness"), borrowed from Latin {it}accessiōn-, accessiō{/it} "approach, onset, paroxysm, addition, accessory," from {it}accēdere{/it} "to approach" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō{/it}, suffix of action nouns {ma}{mat|accede|}{/ma}
shortdef: the act or process by which someone rises to a position of honor or power
an act of coming near or to something : approach, admittance
